required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Safety and Efficacy of RGN-259 Ophthalmic Solutions for Dry Eye Syndrome: ARISE-1
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Double Masked, Placebo Controlled Clinical Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of RGN-259 Ophthalmic Solutions for the Treatment of Dry Eye: ARISE-1

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of RGN-259 Ophthalmic Solutions to placebo for the treatment of the signs and symptoms of dry eye.

detailed_description.textblock: Dry eye can be caused by many variable factors. Some examples include hormonal changes due to aging, or living in an environment of low humidity for long periods of time. Dry eye is a complex disease that may result in symptoms like discomfort, visual disturbance, and dryness. Patients with dry eye often have damage on the surface of the eye. In previous studies, RGN-259 has been shown to promote healing of the surface of the eye and decrease inflammation. It suggests that RGN-259 has a significant potential to be an important new safe and effective therapeutic in the treatment of dry eye syndrome.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Total corneal fluorescein staining score at day29
Total ocular discomfort score at day29

secondary_outcome.measure: Tear film break-up time at day 8, 15, 29
Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI)© at day 8, 15, 29

other_outcome.measure: Visual acuity ( ETDRS, Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study scale) at 1, 8, 15, 29 days after first dosing
Change in biomicroscopy using slit-lamp at 8, 15, 29 days after first dosing
Corneal Sensitivity (aesthesiometer (Cochet-Bonnet at 1, 8, 15, 29 days after first dosing
Adverse event query at Visits 1,2,3, 4 and 5
Change in biomicroscopy using Undilated Fundoscopy at 1, 29 days after first dosing
Intraocular Pressure at Visits 1, 29 days after first dosing

arm_group.description: High dose RGN-259: It is a preservative-free, sterile eye drop solution containing Tβ4
It is composed of the same excipients as RGN-259 but does not contain Tβ4
Low dose RGN-259: It is a preservative-free, sterile eye drop solution containing Tβ4

intervention.description: A preservative-free, sterile eye drop solution containing Tβ4 for direct instillation into each eye, four times a day (QID) for 28 days
It is composed of the same excipients as RGN-259 but does not contain Tβ4
